data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: We sometimes encounter people, even perfect strangers, who begin to interest us at first sight, somehow suddenly, all at once, before a word has been spoken.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: Realists do not fear the results of their study.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: To love someone means to see him as God intended him.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: Deprived of meaningful work, men and women lose their reason for existence; they go stark, raving mad.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: Man only likes to count his troubles, but he does not count his joys.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: The formula 'Two and two make five' is not without its attractions.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: Happiness does not lie in happiness, but in the achievement of it.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: Much unhappiness has come into the world because of bewilderment and things left unsaid.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: Power is given only to those who dare to lower themselves and pick it up. Only one thing matters, one thing; to be able to dare!

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: The greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: Man is fond of counting his troubles, but he does not count his joys. If he counted them up as he ought to, he would see that every lot has enough happiness provided for it.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: A novel is a work of poetry. In order to write it, one must have tranquility of spirit and of impression.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: Sarcasm: the last refuge of modest and chaste-souled people when the privacy of their soul is coarsely and intrusively invaded.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: It seems, in fact, as though the second half of a man's life is made up of nothing, but the habits he has accumulated during the first half.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: If there is no God, everything is permitted.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: A real gentleman, even if he loses everything he owns, must show no emotion. Money must be so far beneath a gentleman that it is hardly worth troubling about.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: If you were to destroy the belief in immortality in mankind, not only love but every living force on which the continuation of all life in the world depended, would dry up at once.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: Beauty is mysterious as well as terrible. God and devil are fighting there, and the battlefield is the heart of man.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: The cleverest of all, in my opinion, is the man who calls himself a fool at least once a month.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: To live without Hope is to Cease to live.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: There is no subject so old that something new cannot be said about it.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: It is not possible to eat me without insisting that I sing praises of my devourer?

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: There are things which a man is afraid to tell even to himself, and every decent man has a number of such things stored away in his mind.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: The soul is healed by being with children.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: Man, so long as he remains free, has no more constant and agonizing anxiety than find as quickly as possible someone to worship.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: Men do not accept their prophets and slay them, but they love their martyrs and worship those whom they have tortured to death.

data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
data.en: One can know a man from his laugh, and if you like a man's laugh before you know anything of him, you may confidently say that he is a good man.
